title: 109_hr5421
content: Restoration of estate tax and repeal of carryover basis. The text chunk discusses the repeal of certain sections of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, specifically Subtitles A and E of Title V. It also mentions amendments to section 901 of the Act, with changes to the applicability of certain provisions after December 31, 2010. Additionally, there are conforming amendments to sections 511(d) and (e) of the Act. The repeal of certain sections of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 is hereby enacted, reverting the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to its original state. The Estate and Gift Tax rates are reduced to 15 percent or the generally applicable capital gains rate for individuals. The Estate Tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to compute the tax as 15 percent of the sum of the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts, minus the tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. The Estate Tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to compute the tax as 15 percent of the sum of the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts, minus the tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. Amendments are made to sections 2010 and 2101 of the Code to adjust the applicable credit amount and exclusion amount. The Estate Tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to calculate the tax based on the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts, minus the tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. Amendments are made to sections 2102 and 2201 of the Code to adjust certain amounts. The Estate Tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to calculate the tax based on the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts. Section 2502 is amended to modify the gift tax provisions. The tax rate for taxable gifts is set at 15 percent under section 2502. Donors are responsible for paying the tax. Amendments remove section 2504 and provide a $5,000,000 exemption from estate and gift taxes effective after December 31, 2006. The amendment provides a $5,000,000 exemption from estate and gift taxes for estates of decedents dying and gifts made after December 31, 2006.
